trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.ShowItemCommands"></xref> event of an <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref>.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

An instance of a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListShowCommandsEventArgs> object is automatically created and passed to the event handler for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.ShowItemCommands> event of an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList>.

An inherited class or event handler can use this event to show commands unique to the item, by changing the collection of commands in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.Commands%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListShowCommandsEventArgs"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

Constructs a new <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListShowCommandsEventArgs> object, initializing the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListShowCommandsEventArgs.ListItem%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListShowCommandsEventArgs.Commands%2A> properties with the values of the `item` and `commands` parameters, respectively.
Initializes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListShowCommandsEventArgs.ListItem"></xref> property.
Initializes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListShowCommandsEventArgs.Commands"></xref> property.
Gets or sets the collection of commands in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection"></xref> objects.
Initially, the collection is empty.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

You can add or remove commands in the collection by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection.AddAt%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection.Remove%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection.RemoveAt%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection> class.

You can use this property to access and modify the commands for a single item in an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList> object during the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.ShowItemCommands> event.
Changes made do not affect the base collection of commands specified for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList> object.
The collection of commands in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection"></xref>.
Returns the list item for the specified commands that will be displayed.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The list item for the specified commands that will be displayed.
